paragraphs.text: I had a plan to go to Berkeley, kick ass in school, get an amazing job, be married by 25, and have a McMansion filled with kids by 30. Everywhere I went, I’d be called Mr. Rao, eat at the most expensive restaurants and stay in 5-star hotels.

Trust that all you’ve learned was worth learning, no matter what answer you have or do not have about what practical use it has in your life. Let whatever mysterious starlight that guided you this far guide you onward into the crazy beauty that awaits
paragraphs.name: 4df6

paragraphs.text: There are always going to be goals that we set but don’t accomplish. That doesn’t mean we shouldn’t set such goals. We learn more from the pursuit of a goal than we do from its accomplishment. It’s the pursuit that changes us. I had a goal to become a NY Times bestselling author. I didn’t accomplish that goal, but in pursuit of it, I transformed many of my habits, behaviors, and beliefs. Transformation is the ultimate purpose any goal. No matter how grand the accomplishment, the buzz and the novelty will eventually wear off. So it’s a lousy way to measure your happiness and satisfaction. But if the transformation sticks, our effort won’t have been in vain.
paragraphs.name: e67c
57de
paragraphs.text: 15. Invest in Yourself and Make Self-Care a Priority

paragraphs.name: c751
paragraphs.text: 13. Be Skeptical of Advice Offered From People That Don’t have the Life You Want

paragraphs.name: 8adf
paragraphs.text: Education is about memorizing facts, regurgitating those facts on tests to earn good grades, and getting pieces of paper that your parents can hang in frames on the wall at their houses. There’s such a wall at my parent’s house. On one side are my sister’s degrees and on the other are mine.

paragraphs.name: 3feb
paragraphs.text: The self-help books, gratitude interventions, and every other thing I’d learned about positive psychology from 100’s of interviews did nothing for me. But with the help of Brian Koehn, and my therapist I pulled out of it after about 3–4 months. This was my crucible.

b7890dc5b496.title: Investing in yourself is learning and growth that helps you be more of who you are, not what others…

paragraphs.name: cc07
paragraphs.text: Investing in yourself is learning and growth that helps you be more of who you are, not what others expect you to be. Self-care is making your health a priority by eating more plants, daily exercise, and slowing down. It took me over twenty years to learn this.

virtuals.subtitle: I then have to remind myself that they didn’t smell the flowers on the way there. They’re always going to be going for that next summit.

paragraphs.text: Great post, Srini! 28 definitely hits home for me. Sometimes it really irritates me seeing other people catch on fire and “reach the summit” — especially if they started their creative journey after I got started and they seem to have all the hacks to get there.

3c5b8f0be638.title: There’s a lot of thought here.

paragraphs.text: There’s a lot of thought here. A lot of text. You cover a lot of ground. You are intense. And I agree with pretty much everything. It’s a lot to digest though. This would have been easier to swallow as a 3 part piece. But either way… Wow! Good stuff. I will be coming back to this in the near future.

virtuals.subtitle: Also, love the nods to Cheryl Strayed. She’s awesome.

content.subtitle: Also, love the nods to Cheryl Strayed. She’s awesome.

paragraphs.name: 138a
paragraphs.text: Such a great read. Thank you for sharing your insights. I’m quickly learning that no one truly has this thing called life figured out, you have to be aware that the only thing constant is change/growth and to trust that your life path doesn’t have to be the exact same as others…or linear to be honest.
